title: 1122 Program Open Records Request for Wilmington PD

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: 1122 Program Open Records Request for Wilmington PD
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-An itemized list of all purchases of equipment by the Wilmington Police Department through the 1122 program (10 U.S. Code § 281) from 1994 to 2024. This can be provided by collated receipts for purchases.

-All 1122C: Usage Reports and purchase orders submitted by Wilmington Police Department to the 1122 Program state point of contact (SPOC). According to the 1122 Program Guide, 1122C: Usage Reports and purchase orders are required to be sent to the SPOC within 30 days of purchase.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Lillian Mauldin.

title: Energy and Environmental FOIA Records Requests (Environmental Protection Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide documentation of any FOIA requests that have contained the following phrases:

“Gas stove”
“Gas range”
“Indoor air pollution” (or “air pollution indoors”)
“Indoor air quality”
“Indoor pollutants”
“Electrification” (or “home electrification”)
High Efficiency Electric Home Rebate Act
The Energy Efficient Home Improvement credit
New Energy Efficient Home credit
The Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund
The Residential Clean Energy credit
“Induction stove”
“Electric appliances”
“Electric heating and cooling”
“Mechanical heating and cooling”
“Heat pump”
“Tax credits”
“Respiratory disease”
“Cardiovascular disease”
“Rebates”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Terry Brown

title: Gas Stove FOIA Records Request (Environmental Protection Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documentation regarding any requests for any records of communication between the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) and gas stove manufacturers, gas companies, or related companies or trade associations regarding the health effects of indoor air pollution from gas stoves/ranges/ovens.

Documentation regarding any requests for records of communication between CPSC and gas stove manufacturers, gas companies, or related companies or trade associations regarding potential regulatory or research initiatives related to gas stoves/ranges/ovens.

Documentation regarding any requests for records of communication between CPSC and health and medical researchers, practitioners, doctors, medical associations, or related groups regarding health risks related to gas stoves/ranges/ovens. 

Documentation regarding any requests for records related heat pump access programs.

Documentation regarding any requests for records related to the High Efficiency Electric Home Rebate Act, the Energy Efficient Home Improvement credit, New Energy Efficient Home credit, the Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund, or the Residential Clean Energy credit.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Terry Brown
